intro: Milnea lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milnea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its lance-shaped leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. Milnea lancifolia thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens and borders.
